subtopic: Can I reduce my risk of cancer if I stop drinking alcohol?
content:
## Can I reduce my risk of cancer if I stop drinking alcohol?
Can I reduce my risk of cancer if I stop drinking alcohol?
Giving up or significantly cutting down on alcohol drinking will reduce your risk of cancer after several years, but may not completely eliminate it depending on your lifetime exposure. In addition, it will also reduce the other harms caused by alcohol consumption. But remember that smoking tobacco and drinking alcohol is the worse combination for health and to reduce your risk of cancer you should both
quit smoking
and stop drinking alcohol.
